title: How to Charge the Pro Controller on the Nintendo Switch

steps.headline: Open the back panel of the Nintendo Switch dock.
steps.description: The Nintendo Switch dock is the rectangle-shaped device that the Nintendo Switch sits in to charge and play on the TV. The back panel is the side that has the oval-shaped Nintendo logo. The back panel opens from the top.

steps.headline: Connect the Nintendo Switch charger to the dock.
steps.description: Plug the official charger for the Nintendo Switch into a wall outlet, and then plug the connector into the port labeled "AC Adapter" in the back-panel of the dock. Run the cable through the slot for wires on the side of the Nintendo Switch dock.

steps.headline: Connect a USB-C cable to the dock.
steps.description: Connect the USB cable that came with the Nintendo Pro Controller (or any Type C USB cable) to the port labeled "USB" in the back-panel of the Nintendo Switch dock. Run the cable through the slot on the side of the Nintendo Switch so the other end of the USB cable is outside the Nintendo Switch dock.

steps.headline: Connect an HDMI cable (optional).
steps.description: While it's not necessary to connect an HDMI cable to charge the Pro Controller, you do need it to play on a TV. Connect an HDMI cable to the port labeled "HDMI Out" in the back-panel of the Nintendo Switch dock. Run the cable through the slot on the side of the Nintendo Switch dock and connect the other end of the HDMI cable to a free port on your HDTV. With all the cables connected, you can now close the back-panel of the Nintendo Switch dock.

steps.headline: Connect the Pro Controller to the USB cable.
steps.description: With the USB-C cable sticking out of the Nintendo Switch dock, connect the free end of the USB cable to the top of the Nintendo Pro controller to start charging the controller. You can also connect the Nintendo Switch charger directly to the Pro Controller.

text: Open the back panel of the Nintendo Switch dock. The Nintendo Switch dock is the rectangle-shaped device that the Nintendo Switch sits in to charge and play on the TV. The back panel is the side that has the oval-shaped Nintendo logo. The back panel opens from the top. Connect the Nintendo Switch charger to the dock. Plug the official charger for the Nintendo Switch into a wall outlet, and then plug the connector into the port labeled "AC Adapter" in the back-panel of the dock. Run the cable through the slot for wires on the side of the Nintendo Switch dock. Connect a USB-C cable to the dock. Connect the USB cable that came with the Nintendo Pro Controller (or any Type C USB cable) to the port labeled "USB" in the back-panel of the Nintendo Switch dock. Run the cable through the slot on the side of the Nintendo Switch so the other end of the USB cable is outside the Nintendo Switch dock. Connect an HDMI cable (optional). While it's not necessary to connect an HDMI cable to charge the Pro Controller, you do need it to play on a TV. Connect an HDMI cable to the port labeled "HDMI Out" in the back-panel of the Nintendo Switch dock. Run the cable through the slot on the side of the Nintendo Switch dock and connect the other end of the HDMI cable to a free port on your HDTV. With all the cables connected, you can now close the back-panel of the Nintendo Switch dock. Connect the Pro Controller to the USB cable. With the USB-C cable sticking out of the Nintendo Switch dock, connect the free end of the USB cable to the top of the Nintendo Pro controller to start charging the controller. You can also connect the Nintendo Switch charger directly to the Pro Controller.
